Julian, I guess another problem with publishing this kind of stuff is that =
reviewers usually expect experimental results and researchers probably aren=
't very excited by the prospect of running a set of experiments to establis=
h the statistical significance of mundane technical tweaks.  For example, I=
 enjoy sharing my experience and opinions on different sensory setups such =
as egocentric vs. absolute, but I am not very enthusiastic about actually r=
unning a set of systematic experiments to demonstrate the pros and cons abo=
ut them that to me are intuitively evident at this point anyway.  So it's t=
ough- how do we get knowledge out that isn't all that exciting but is still=
 very important as a practical matter?

ken

 articles, and nobody can't point to a systematic study of how

s search.
